Register of interests for Councillor Mark Shooter London Borough of                
Barnet Democracy Home Calendar of meetings Committees Cabinet Forward Plan Committee Forward plans Council Constitution Archived Constitution Schemes of delegation Your Councillors Council decisions Cabinet Member decisions Search documents Petitions Key documents Other elected representatives Outside bodies Register of interests Councillor Mark Shooter This register of interests was published on Tuesday 8th April, 2025, 10.59 am. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Mark Shooter, an Elected Member of the London Borough of Barnet set out below the interests which I am required to declare by law and under the Code of Conduct for Members: PECUNIARY INTERESTS 1. Employment, office, trade, profession or vocation 1. Your employment, office, trade, profession or vocation carried on for profit or gain, and that of your husband/wife/civil partner. Note: “Office” includes position held as representative of the council on the management of an external organisation if an Allowance is paid which exceeds reasonable expenses. Completed by Member Director of SELSDON WAY DEV LTD. Director of CENTRIC HOUSE APARTMENTS LIMITED Director of PERMITTED DEVELOPMENTS INVESTMENTS NO 13 LIMITED Director of BAUMARKT LTD Designated Member of KINGSCROFT ESTATES LLP Designated Member of SILVERLAKE ESTATES LLP Director of THE SHOOTER CHARITABLE FOUNDATION LIMITED Director of GOLD WYNN HEATHROW LTD Director of HEATHROW HOUSE LTD Director of HEATHROW HOUSE HOLDINGS LIMITED Saxon Square Christchurch Ltd Karajan Ltd Antares Greenhouse Gas Reduction LLP Permitted Development No Ltd Centric House Apart Ltd Director of Selsdon Way Development Ltd Director of Station House Management Services Ltd Secretary of JV Tower Ltd Director of JV Tower 1 Ltd Secretary of JV Tower 2 Ltd Director of Station House Management Services Ltd Director at Goldwynn UK Holdings Limited Director of Heathrow House Hold Ltd SH Milton Keynes Travel Ltd Director of SH Milton Keynes Travel Ltd Director of Goldwynn Quay Management Ltd 2. Sponsorship 2. Any payment or provision of any other financial benefit in respect of any expenses incurred in carrying out duties or towards election expenses; this includes any payment or financial benefit from a trade union. Completed by Member None. 3. Contracts 3. Any contract which is made between you or your husband/wife/civil partner (or a body in which you or your husband/wife/ civil partner has a beneficial interest) and the Council under which goods or services are to be provided or works are to be executed and which has not been fully discharged. Completed by Member None 4. Land 4. Any beneficial interest in land held by you or your husband, wife or partner which is within the area of the council. Completed by Member Dispensation granted - 20.09.2023 5. Licences 5. Any licence (alone or jointly with others) to you or your husband/wife/civil partner to occupy land in Barnet for a month or longer. For completion by Member None. 6. Corporate tenancies 6. Any tenancy where the landlord is the Council and the tenant is a body in which you or your husband/wife/civil partner has a beneficial interest. Completed by Member None. 7. Securities 7. Any beneficial interest in which you or your husband/wife/civil partner has in securities of a body where: (a) that body has a place of business or land in the area of the Council; and (b) either: (i) the total nominal value of the securities exceeds £25,000 or one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that body; or  (ii) if the share capital of that body is of more than one class, the total nominal value of the shares of any one class in which you or a relevant person has a beneficial interest exceeds one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that class. Completed by Member None. 8. Personal wellbeing You may also have a pecuniary interest where you attend a committee meeting of the council where the business concerns your personal wellbeing or financial position or that of your husband, wife, partner to a greater extent than the majority of residents in your Ward affected by the decision. Please note that you will only know this when you attend a committee meeting or full council and an item on the agenda affects your wellbeing or that of your husband, wife, partner to the extent described above. You must then declare a pecuniary interest at the beginning of the meeting or before the relevant agenda item is discussed and not take part in the meeting when that agenda item is discussed. 9. Other Interests 8. Other Interests are ones where: a) Any decision in relation to the item at a meeting might reasonably be regarded as affecting the well-being or financial standing of you or a member of your family or a person with whom you have a close association to a greater extent than it would affect the majority of the Council Tax payers, ratepayers or inhabitants of the ward or electoral area for which you have been elected or otherwise of the authority’s administrative area. b) A close family member is a spouse, civil partner or any person living with the member as a spouse or civil partner, or a Member’s brother or sister, son or daughter or a parent. Completed by Member None. Hospitality If you receive or have declined any gift or hospitality with an estimated value of at least £25 in your capacity as a Councillor, then you must give details in writing to the Council’s Monitoring Officer within 28 days of your receiving the gift or hospitality. These details must include the name of the donor, his or her main business (if appropriate), the nature of the gift or hospitality and its estimated value. Declaration I recognise that I will be in breach of the Council’s Code of Conduct for Members if I:      (a)	Omit information that ought to be given in this notice      (b)	Provide information that is materially false or misleading    (c)	Fail to give further notice within 28 days of any change to the information set out above in order to bring up to date the information given in this notice. 9. Dispensations Dispensations Granted None 10. My form has been signed and dated Signed - Print name Date Mark Shooter 08/05/18 Mark Shooter 11/01/22 Mark Shooter 04/04/22 Mark Shooter 11/04/22 Mark Shooter 09/05/22 Mark Shooter 15/07/22 Mark Shooter 01/09/22 Mark Shooter 26/04/23 Mark Shooter 20/07/23 Mark Shooter 15/09/23 Mark Shooter 13/10/23 Mark Shooter 24/11/23 Mark Shooter 20/12/23 Mark Shooter 28/01/24 Mark Shooter 11/06/24 Mark Shooter 12/07/24 Mark Shooter 06/01/25 Mark Shooter 03/04/25 Copyright Privacy notice Accessibility Disclaimer London 
Borough of							Barnet

Register of interests for Councillor Dawn Abbott - Derbyshire County Council Alert close - icon Fill 1 Copy 10 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Untitled-1 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Fill 1 Copy 10 menu Group 3 Group 3 Copy 3 Group 3 Copy Page 1 Group 2 Group 2 Skip to content Derbyshire County Council Staff website icon Staff website Subscribe icon Subscribe for updates Menu Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Councillor Dawn Abbott This register of interests was published on Tuesday, 29 July 2025, 1.26 pm. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Dawn Abbott a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. Register of interests for Councillor Nick Adams - Derbyshire County Council Alert close - icon Fill 1 Copy 10 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Untitled-1 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Fill 1 Copy 10 menu Group 3 Group 3 Copy 3 Group 3 Copy Page 1 Group 2 Group 2 Skip to content Derbyshire County Council Staff website icon Staff website Subscribe icon Subscribe for updates Menu Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Councillor Nick Adams This register of interests was published on Thursday, 31 July 2025, 4.38 pm. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Nick Adams a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. Register of interests for Councillor Martin Bromley - Derbyshire County Council Alert close - icon Fill 1 Copy 10 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Untitled-1 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Fill 1 Copy 10 menu Group 3 Group 3 Copy 3 Group 3 Copy Page 1 Group 2 Group 2 Skip to content Derbyshire County Council Staff website icon Staff website Subscribe icon Subscribe for updates Menu Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Councillor Martin Bromley This register of interests was published on Thursday, 31 July 2025, 4.42 pm. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Martin Bromley a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity Broxtowe Borough Council Nottinghamshire - Housing grants DFG Technical Officer Self-Employment - Supply of Architectural Services Springfield Junior School Swadlincote Derbyshire employed by outside catering contractor - Dinner Time Kitchen Assistant 2. Sponsorship Details of Sponsorship Reform UK South Derbyshire Branch - Purchase of election materials 3. Contracts Description of Contract ABM Catering - 2 Year left contract to supply school dinners for Springfield School Swadlincote 4. Land Address/Description of Land “A disclosable pecuniary interest has been registered but is considered sensitive under Section 32 of the Localism Act 2011 and has not been published” 397 Burton Road Midway Swadlincote Derbyshire DE11 7NB - Landlord 5. Licences Address/description of Land None 6. Corporate tenancies Address/Description of Property None 7. Securities Name of Company None B - Other Registerable interests: 8. Any unpaid directorships You None 9. Any body of which you are a governing member or in a position of general control or management and to which you are appointed or nominated by the Council. You Shardlow Acre Lane Quarry Liason Group Elvaston Quarry Liason Group Goseley Community Centre Management Committee 10. Any body: a) exercising functions of a public nature b) directed to charitable purposes; or c) one of whose principal purposes includes the influence of public opinion or policy (including any political party or trade union),  of which you are a member or in a position of general control or management You Reform UK Member 11. Any trade union of which you are a member and membership of pressure groups, the Freemasons or other influential bodies of which you are a member. You None C. Gifts and Hospitality 12. Any gift, benefit or hospitality with a value in excess of £50 which you have accepted as a member from any person or body other than the Council. Register of interests for Councillor David Elsdon - Derbyshire County Council Alert close - icon Fill 1 Copy 10 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Untitled-1 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Fill 1 Copy 10 menu Group 3 Group 3 Copy 3 Group 3 Copy Page 1 Group 2 Group 2 Skip to content Derbyshire County Council Staff website icon Staff website Subscribe icon Subscribe for updates Menu Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Councillor David Elsdon This register of interests was published on Tuesday, 29 July 2025, 11.10 am. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor David Elsdon a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity Daena Global Ltd - Director and Chief Technology Officer Unitec Projects Ltd - Director Derbyshire Combined Fire Authority 2. Sponsorship Details of Sponsorship None 3. Contracts Description of Contract None 4. Land Address/Description of Land 12 Jubilee Crescent
Killamarsh
Derbyshire
S21 1BR 5. Licences Address/description of Land None 6. Corporate tenancies Address/Description of Property None 7. Securities Name of Company None B - Other Registerable interests: 8. Any unpaid directorships You None 9. Any body of which you are a governing member or in a position of general control or management and to which you are appointed or nominated by the Council. You Derbyshire Archaeological Advisory Committee 10. Any body: a) exercising functions of a public nature b) directed to charitable purposes; or c) one of whose principal purposes includes the influence of public opinion or policy (including any political party or trade union),  of which you are a member or in a position of general control or management You Reform UK 11. Any trade union of which you are a member and membership of pressure groups, the Freemasons or other influential bodies of which you are a member. You None C. Gifts and Hospitality 12. Any gift, benefit or hospitality with a value in excess of £50 which you have accepted as a member from any person or body other than the Council. You None Accessibility | Disclaimer | Cookies | Privacy policy | Modern Slavery Act Facebook Twitter YouTube LinkedIn © Derbyshire County Council 2022 Browser does not support script. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Alan Graves a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity Alan Graves Foundation Norcon Computers Ltd Derby City Council - Elected Member 2. I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. Register of interests for Councillor John Lawson - Derbyshire County Council Alert close - icon Fill 1 Copy 10 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Untitled-1 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Fill 1 Copy 10 menu Group 3 Group 3 Copy 3 Group 3 Copy Page 1 Group 2 Group 2 Skip to content Derbyshire County Council Staff website icon Staff website Subscribe icon Subscribe for updates Menu Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Councillor John Lawson This register of interests was published on Thursday, 31 July 2025, 5.13 pm. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor John Lawson a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity Swiftool Precision Engineering Ltd - Finance Director Ingeniocity Ltd - Director/Shareholder Amber Valley CVS - Domestic support 2. Sponsorship Details of Sponsorship Election leaflets paid by Reform UK Erewash branch - £82 3. Contracts Description of Contract None 4. Land Address/Description of Land “A disclosable pecuniary interest has been registered but is considered sensitive under Section 32 of the Localism Act 2011 and has not been published” “A disclosable pecuniary interest has been registered but is considered sensitive under Section 32 of the Localism Act 2011 and has not been published” 5. Licences Address/description of Land None 6. Corporate tenancies Address/Description of Property None 7. Securities Name of Company None B - Other Registerable interests: 8. Any unpaid directorships You None 9. Any body of which you are a governing member or in a position of general control or management and to which you are appointed or nominated by the Council. You East Midlands County Combined Authority – Investment Committee - Derbyshire County Council representative Visit Peak District and Derbyshire Destination Marketing Agency - Derbyshire County Council representative Destination Marketing Agency 10. Any body: a) exercising functions of a public nature b) directed to charitable purposes; or c) one of whose principal purposes includes the influence of public opinion or policy (including any political party or trade union),  of which you are a member or in a position of general control or management You Reform UK - Member Chartered Institute of Management Accountants - Member 11. Any trade union of which you are a member and membership of pressure groups, the Freemasons or other influential bodies of which you are a member. You None C. Gifts and Hospitality 12. Register of interests for Councillor Alex Millward - Derbyshire County Council Alert close - icon Fill 1 Copy 10 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Untitled-1 Untitled-1 tt copy 3 Fill 1 Copy 10 menu Group 3 Group 3 Copy 3 Group 3 Copy Page 1 Group 2 Group 2 Skip to content Derbyshire County Council Staff website icon Staff website Subscribe icon Subscribe for updates Menu Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Calendar Committees Constitution Decisions Election results ePetitions Forthcoming Decisions Forward plans Library Meetings Outside bodies Search documents Subscribe to updates Councillors Executive Posts MPs What's New Register of interests Councillor Alex Millward This register of interests was published on Thursday, 31 July 2025, 5.17 pm. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Alex Millward a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity Hooplight Ltd - Director 2. Sponsorship Details of Sponsorship None 3. Contracts Description of Contract None 4. Land Address/Description of Land None 5. Licences Address/description of Land None 6. Corporate tenancies Address/Description of Property None 7. Securities Name of Company None B - Other Registerable interests: 8. Any unpaid directorships You None 9. Any body of which you are a governing member or in a position of general control or management and to which you are appointed or nominated by the Council. You Hooplight Ltd 10. Any body: a) exercising functions of a public nature b) directed to charitable purposes; or c) one of whose principal purposes includes the influence of public opinion or policy (including any political party or trade union),  of which you are a member or in a position of general control or management You Reform UK 11. Any trade union of which you are a member and membership of pressure groups, the Freemasons or other influential bodies of which you are a member. You None C. Gifts and Hospitality 12. Any gift, benefit or hospitality with a value in excess of £50 which you have accepted as a member from any person or body other than the Council. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Dan Price a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity Sole trader - Engineering Erewash Borough Council - Elected Member Derbyshire Combined Fire Authority - Derbyshire County Council representative Carer/PA (Personal Assistant) 2. Sponsorship Details of Sponsorship Reform UK 3. Contracts Description of Contract None 4. Land Address/Description of Land “A disclosable pecuniary interest has been registered but is considered sensitive under Section 32 of the Localism Act 2011 and has not been published” “A disclosable pecuniary interest has been registered but is considered sensitive under Section 32 of the Localism Act 2011 and has not been published” 5. Licences Address/description of Land None 6. Corporate tenancies Address/Description of Property None 7. Securities Name of Company None B - Other Registerable interests: 8. Any unpaid directorships You None 9. Any body of which you are a governing member or in a position of general control or management and to which you are appointed or nominated by the Council. You Erewash Community Safety Partnership - Derbyshire County Council representative National Coal Mining Museum for England Liaison Committee - Derbyshire County Council representative 10. Any body: a) exercising functions of a public nature b) directed to charitable purposes; or c) one of whose principal purposes includes the influence of public opinion or policy (including any political party or trade union),  of which you are a member or in a position of general control or management You Reform UK - Member Erewash Reform - Chairman 11. Any trade union of which you are a member and membership of pressure groups, the Freemasons or other influential bodies of which you are a member. You None C. Gifts and Hospitality 12. Any gift, benefit or hospitality with a value in excess of £50 which you have accepted as a member from any person or body other than the Council. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Stephen Reed a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity North East Derbyshire District Council - Elected Member 2. Sponsorship Details of Sponsorship North East Derbyshire Reform Association (May 2025 election campaign materials) 3. Contracts Description of Contract None 4. Land Address/Description of Land A disclosable pecuniary interest has been registered but is considered sensitive under Section 32 of the Localism Act 2011 and has not been published A disclosable pecuniary interest has been registered but is considered sensitive under Section 32 of the Localism Act 2011 and has not been published 5. Licences Address/description of Land None 6. Corporate tenancies Address/Description of Property None 7. Securities Name of Company None B - Other Registerable interests: 8. Any unpaid directorships You None 9. Any body of which you are a governing member or in a position of general control or management and to which you are appointed or nominated by the Council. You EMCCA Investment Committee - Member EMCCA Board - substitute 10. Any body: a) exercising functions of a public nature b) directed to charitable purposes; or c) one of whose principal purposes includes the influence of public opinion or policy (including any political party or trade union),  of which you are a member or in a position of general control or management You Killamarsh Parish Council - Elected Member North East Derbyshire District Council - Elected Member 11. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view I, Councillor Joseph Turrell a Member of Derbyshire County Council, give notice that: I have set out in the relevant sections of the form, my interests and the interests of my spouse or civil partner, or person with whom I am living as if we were husband and wife or civil partners, of which I am aware, which I am required to disclose under the council's Code of Conduct. Where neither I nor my spouse nor civil partner nor person with whom I am living as husband and wife or civil partners have any interests to disclose within a particular section, I have put 'none'. I understand and acknowledge that: 1.I must complete, sign and return this notice within 28 days of my election or appointment to office. 2.I must register my Disclosable Pecuniary Interests and Personal Interests by providing written notification to the council's Monitoring Officer of the details required as set out in this form. 3.I must, within 28 days of declaring an unregistered Declarable Pecuniary Interest or Personal Interest at a meeting, provide written notification to the Monitoring Officer of that interest. 4.Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 5. I must, within 28 days of receiving any further gift of hospitality with an estimated value of at least £50, provide written notification to the Council’s Monitoring Officer. 6. I understand that Disclosable Pecuniary Interests include not only my interests but also the interests of my spouse or civil partner, a person with whom I am living as husband and wife, or a person with whom I am living as if we were civil partners, so far as I am aware of the interests of that person. 7. The Localism Act 2011 has created specific criminal offences in relation to the disclosure of Disclosable Pecuniary Interests (Part A of this form).  I understand that I commit an offence if, without reasonable excuse, I: (a) fail to register a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest within 28 days of my election, re-election or appointment to office; (b) fail to disclose at a meeting of the Council the nature and existence of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest unless I have disclosed the interest to the Monitoring Officer, who has agreed that the interest amounts to a sensitive interest; (c) fail to notify the Monitoring Officer of a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest that I have disclosed at a meeting of the Council within 28 days of the date I made the disclosure; (d) continue to deal with a matter in which I have a Disclosable Pecuniary Interest (other than for the purpose of enabling the matter to be dealt with otherwise than by me) without being granted a dispensation; (e) provide information that is false or misleading in respect of any notification of my interests and I know that that information is false or misleading, or I am reckless as to whether the information is true and not misleading. 8. Any allegation that I have committed an offence relating to the notification and disclosure of my interests may be investigated by the police and referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions.  Upon conviction, I understand that I am liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 (currently £5000) on the standard scale and that I may be disqualified for up to 5 years from being or becoming a member or co-opted member of any authority. 9. If I feel I have an interest which, if disclosed on a public register, could lead to me or a person connected with me being subject to violence or intimidation, I will disclose this as a sensitive interest to the Monitoring Officer and seek their approval for this information to remain confidential. A - Disclosable Pecuniary Interests: 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation Description of employment activity Loss prevention officer - TKMaxx 2. Sponsorship Details of Sponsorship £114 worth of leaflets given by Caroline Mason on behalf of Reform UK £82 worth of leaflets given by Caroline Mason on behalf of Reform UK 3. Contracts Description of Contract None 4. Land Address/Description of Land None 5. Licences Address/description of Land None 6. Corporate tenancies Address/Description of Property None 7. Securities Name of Company None B - Other Registerable interests: 8. Any unpaid directorships You None 9. Any body of which you are a governing member or in a position of general control or management and to which you are appointed or nominated by the Council. You Member of the Health Scrutiny Committee Member of the Place Scrutiny Committee Member of the Joint Health Scrutiny panel – Association of Greater Manchester Councils Member of the Skills and Employment Advisory Committee – East Midlands County Combined Authority Member of the Council of Governors – University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust 10. Any body: a) exercising functions of a public nature b) directed to charitable purposes; or c) one of whose principal purposes includes the influence of public opinion or policy (including any political party or trade union),  of which you are a member or in a position of general control or management You Reform UK - Member 11. Any trade union of which you are a member and membership of pressure groups, the Freemasons or other influential bodies of which you are a member. You None C. Gifts and Hospitality 12. Any employment, office, trade, profession or vocation carried on by you or those persons referred to above for profit or gain. This includes any payment or financial benefit from a trade union within the meaning of the Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992. None A description of any contract for goods, services or works made between the County Council and you or the persons referred to above (or a body in which you or they have a beneficial interest) and which has not been fully discharged. None Any tenancy where to your knowledge the landlord is the County Council and the tenant is a body in which you have or a person referred to above has a beneficial interest. None The name of any person or body in which you have or a person referred to above has a beneficial interest in securities of that body where: (a) that body to your knowledge has a place of business or land in the area of the County Council; and (b) either- (i) the total nominal value of the securities exceeds £25,000 or one hundredth of the total issue share capital of that body; or (ii) if the share capital of that body is of more than one class, the total nominal value of the shares of any one class in which you have or a person referred to above has a beneficial interest exceeds one hundredth of the total issue share capital of that class. None Personal Interests Members are required to register only their own interests under this heading. "Pecuniary and Non-pecuniary interest" means an interest which is my interest, my spouse's or civil partner's or the interests of somebody I am living with as a husband or wife, or as civil partners and I am aware that the other person has the interest. (NB. These people are referred to below as "the relevant person") 1. (Pecuniary Interest - Employment, office, trade, profession, or vocation) Any employment, office, trade, profession, or vocation carried on for profit or gain: Description of your employment Details None - 2. (Pecuniary Interest - Sponsorship) Any payment or provision of any other financial benefit (other than from the county council) made or provided within the relevant period in respect of any expenses incurred by me in carrying out duties as a member, or towards my election expenses.  This includes any payment or financial benefit from a trade union within the meaning of the Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992: Name of Person or Body making payment Details of payment or benefit None - 3. (Pecuniary Interest - Contracts) Any contract which is made between the relevant person (or a body in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest) and the county council: (a) under which goods or services are to be provided or works are to be executed and (b) which has not been fully discharged: Description of contract None 4. (Pecuniary Interest - Land) Any beneficial interest in land which is in the county council's area: Address/description of land Nature of Interest in land Sensitive information held under Section 32 of the Localism Act 5. (Pecuniary Interest - Licences) Any licence (alone or jointly with others) to occupy land in the county council's area for a month or longer: Address/description of land Nature of Interest in land None - 6. (Pecuniary Interest - Corporate Tenancies) Any tenancy where (to my knowledge): (a) the landlord is the county council; and (b) the tenant is a body in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest: Address/description of land Nature of Interest in land None - 7. (Pecuniary Interest - Securities) Any beneficial interest in securities of a body where: (a) that body (to my knowledge) has a place of business or land in the county council's area; and (b) either (i) the total nominal value of the securities exceeds £25,000 or one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that body; or (ii) if the share capital of that body is more than one class, the total nominal value of the shares of any one class in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest exceeds one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that class: Name of body None 8. (Non-Pecuniary Interest - Outside Bodies) Any position of general control or management, or membership of any body, except where the nomination to that body has been made by the County Council: Name of Body Details Reform UK Member About us (Lancashire County Council) Privacy Accessibility Cookies Contact us (Lancashire County Council) © 2026, Lancashire County Council PO Box 78, County Hall, Fishergate, Preston, Lancashire, PR1 8XJ

Register of interests for Councillor Jordan Tarrant-Short Rochdale Borough Council Home > Councillors and elections > Councillors and committees > Register of interests Register of interests Councillor Jordan Tarrant-Short This register of interests was published on Tuesday, 27th January, 2026, 8.46 am. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view REGISTER OF MEMBERS INTERESTS I, Councillor Jordan Tarrant-Short, as a Member of Rochdale Metropolitan Borough Council, give notice to the Monitoring Officer of the following Disclosable Pecuniary Interests, as required by Section 30 of the Localism Act 2011, and other interests as required by the Council's code of conduct.  In the notice below I have also included the interests of any relevant persons other than myself as referred to in Section 30(3)(b) of the Localism Act, namely: my spouse or civil partner; 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation - Any employment, office, trade, profession or vocation carried on for profit or gain Myself My Spouse or Partner Common Sense Entertainment Ltd - Director - 2. Sponsorship - Any payment or provision of any other financial benefit (other than from the relevant authority) made or provided within the relevant period in respect of any expenses incurred by you in carrying out duties as a member, or towards the election expenses of you. This includes any payment or financial benefit from a trade union within the meaning of the Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992 Myself My spouse or partner Reform UK - 3. Contracts - Any contract which is made between the relevant person (or a body in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest) and the relevant authority under which goods or services are to be provided or works are to be executed; and/or which has not been fully discharged Myself My spouse or partner None None 4. Land - Any beneficial interest in land which is within the area of the relevant authority. Myself My spouse or partner Sensitive information held under Section 32 of the Localism Act 5. Licences - Any licence (alone or jointly with others) to occupy land in the area of the relevant authority for a month or longer. Myself My spouse or partner None None 6. Corporate tenancies - Any tenancy where (to your knowledge) the landlord is the relevant authority; and the tenant is a body in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest. Myself My spouse or partner None None 7. Securities - Any beneficial interest in securities of a body where (a) that body (to your knowledge) has a place of business or land in the area of the relevant authority; and (b) either (i) the total nominal value of the securities exceeds £25,000 or one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that body; or (ii) if the share capital of that body is of more than one class, the total nominal value of the shares of any one class in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest exceeds one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that class Myself My spouse or partner None None 8. Other Registerable Interests -  the Council Code of Conduct requires members to declare, within 28 days of receipt, any gift, benefit or hospitality with a value in excess of £50 which you have accepted as a member from any person or body other than the authority. Myself None 9. Council Appointed Bodies - A body to which you have been appointed or nominated by Rochdale Metropolitan Borough Council such as school governing bodies or partnerships. Myself None 10. Other Bodies to which you may have been appointed or are a member- A public authority or body exercising functions of a public nature, directed to charitable purposes, or whose principal purpose includes the influence of public opinion or policy e.g. a Trust, an Academy School, a charitable organisation, political party, trade union, or single interest action group. More information about this councillor Printer friendly view REGISTER OF MEMBERS INTERESTS I, Councillor John Taylor, as a Member of Rochdale Metropolitan Borough Council, give notice to the Monitoring Officer of the following Disclosable Pecuniary Interests, as required by Section 30 of the Localism Act 2011, and other interests as required by the Council's code of conduct.  In the notice below I have also included the interests of any relevant persons other than myself as referred to in Section 30(3)(b) of the Localism Act, namely: my spouse or civil partner; 1. Employment, Office, Trade, Profession or Vocation - Any employment, office, trade, profession or vocation carried on for profit or gain Myself My Spouse or Partner None None 2. Sponsorship - Any payment or provision of any other financial benefit (other than from the relevant authority) made or provided within the relevant period in respect of any expenses incurred by you in carrying out duties as a member, or towards the election expenses of you. This includes any payment or financial benefit from a trade union within the meaning of the Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992 Myself My spouse or partner None None 3. Contracts - Any contract which is made between the relevant person (or a body in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest) and the relevant authority under which goods or services are to be provided or works are to be executed; and/or which has not been fully discharged Myself My spouse or partner None None 4. Land - Any beneficial interest in land which is within the area of the relevant authority. Myself My spouse or partner 18 BIrch Road, Littleborough OL12 9QQ 18 BIrch Road, Littleborough OL12 9QQ 37 Heywood Road, Castleton OL11 3BA 37 Heywood Road, Castleton OL11 3BA 75 Hanover Street, Castleton OL11 3AR 75 Hanover Street, Castleton OL11 3AR 46 Bentgate Street, Newhey OL16 4JS 46 Bentgate Street, Newhey OL16 4JS 30 The Glen, Middelton M24 1TH 30 The Glen, Middelton M24 1TH 4 Walton Street, Middleton M24 2GB 4 Walton Street, Middleton M24 2GB Freeholds for 69-95 Hanover Street, Castleton OL11 3AR Freeholds for 69-95 Hanover Street, Castleton OL11 3AR 5. Licences - Any licence (alone or jointly with others) to occupy land in the area of the relevant authority for a month or longer. Myself My spouse or partner None None 6. Corporate tenancies - Any tenancy where (to your knowledge) the landlord is the relevant authority; and the tenant is a body in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest. Myself My spouse or partner None None 7. Securities - Any beneficial interest in securities of a body where (a) that body (to your knowledge) has a place of business or land in the area of the relevant authority; and (b) either (i) the total nominal value of the securities exceeds £25,000 or one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that body; or (ii) if the share capital of that body is of more than one class, the total nominal value of the shares of any one class in which the relevant person has a beneficial interest exceeds one hundredth of the total issued share capital of that class Myself My spouse or partner None None 8. Other Registerable Interests -  the Council Code of Conduct requires members to declare, within 28 days of receipt, any gift, benefit or hospitality with a value in excess of £50 which you have accepted as a member from any person or body other than the authority. Myself Hospitality guest ticket worth £100 to Rochdale Hornets march 31/07/22 Fiji vs England Civic Reception Gala Dinner 05.10.22 worth £51 9. Myself Rochdale Town Centre Management Company Rochdale Safer Communities Partnership 10.
